articles.headline: Disney C.E.O. Bob Iger Hands Keys to Magic Kingdom to Its 7th Chief
articles.snippet: He will be replaced by Bob Chapek, who was most recently chairman of Disney’s parks business.
articles.abstract: He will be replaced by Bob Chapek, who was most recently chairman of Disney’s parks business.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Robert A. Iger, who delayed his retirement four times in recent years, abruptly stepped down as Disney’s chief executive on Tuesday. But he will not be going far.

articles.headline: ‘Not Just an Italian Problem’: Coronavirus Threatens Europe’s Economy
articles.snippet: The spread of the deadly epidemic to Europe’s fourth-largest economy has heightened fears of disruption in the global supply chain.
articles.abstract: The spread of the deadly epidemic to Europe’s fourth-largest economy has heightened fears of disruption in the global supply chain.
articles.lead_paragraph: By the time the deadly coronavirus arrived in Italy’s industrial heartland, shutting down his factory and threatening Europe with economic damage, Antonio Falchetti was already a veteran in the battle to contain the global epidemic.
articles.byline: By Peter S. Goodman and Aaron H. Maines

articles.headline: Amid Insults and Interruptions, Sanders Absorbs Burst of Attacks in Debate
articles.snippet: In a messy Democratic forum, Bernie Sanders, the emerging front-runner, faced his most serious test so far. Michael R. Bloomberg also drew withering criticism.
articles.abstract: In a messy Democratic forum, Bernie Sanders, the emerging front-runner, faced his most serious test so far. Michael R. Bloomberg also drew withering criticism.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — The Democratic presidential candidates delivered a barrage of criticism against their party’s emerging front-runner, Senator Bernie Sanders, at a debate on Tuesday night, casting him as a divisive figure with unrealistic ideas, even as they continued to batter Michael R. Bloomberg for his extreme wealth, his record on policing and his alleged behavior toward women.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Coronavirus Weakens China’s Powerful Propaganda Machine
articles.snippet: Beijing is pushing tales of perseverance, but many young people are openly questioning the Communist Party’s message.
articles.abstract: Beijing is pushing tales of perseverance, but many young people are openly questioning the Communist Party’s message.
articles.lead_paragraph: Exhausted medical workers with faces lined from hours of wearing goggles and surgical masks. Women with shaved heads, a gesture of devotion. Retirees who donate their life savings anonymously in government offices.

articles.headline: Syrian Children Freeze to Death. Bombs Rain Down. And ‘Nobody Cares.’
articles.snippet: The Syrian government’s assault on a rebel-held province has created one of the worst humanitarian emergencies of a brutal nine-year war.
articles.abstract: The Syrian government’s assault on a rebel-held province has created one of the worst humanitarian emergencies of a brutal nine-year war.
articles.lead_paragraph: REYHANLI, Turkey — The baby wasn’t moving. Her body had gone hot, then cold. Her father rushed her to a hospital, going on foot when he could not find a car, but it was too late.
articles.byline: By Vivian Yee and Hwaida Saad

articles.headline: Trump Names Mike Pence to Lead Coronavirus Response
articles.snippet: President Trump sought to reassure the country that his government was controlling the spread of the coronavirus after his administration weathered days of criticism.
articles.abstract: President Trump sought to reassure the country that his government was controlling the spread of the coronavirus after his administration weathered days of criticism.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump named Vice President Mike Pence on Wednesday to coordinate the government’s response to the coronavirus, even as he repeatedly played down the danger to the United States of a widespread domestic outbreak.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Noah Weiland and Katie Rogers
